title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: After receiving the initial email expressing interest, I had a one-way video interview, followed by an in-person interview on campus. Both were pleasant. the first was maybe 30 minutes, the second an hour. I would share a piece of advice I heard once I got the job: when submitting a cover letter and resume, make sure you touch on EACH bullet point in the job description at least once. Most large higher ed institutions' application review processes are very literal. Good luck!
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with a difficult external customer or stakeholder. How did you work through the situation? What did you learn from the experience?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: By this time, I've had 7 interviews for 5 different positions (including Academic Advisor, Student Services Coordinator, and Office Administrator), with each position being in a different school/college/department at the U of M. All 7 interviews have been professional and even somewhat enjoyable. So far, I haven't experienced any red flags during the interview process. A couple of notes: - One second-round interview was difficult in that part of the 3-hour agenda was me giving a 10-minute presentation that they had me prepare beforehand. I don't typically like "working for free," but I thought the problem they had me tackle was an interesting one. - One first-round interview was a one-way video interview, which I've never done before. However, I think it must've gone pretty okay because they contacted me for a second-round in a couple of weeks. I haven't been offered any positions from U of M yet, but I'm optimistic that I'll land one soon!
Interview Questions: Share a situation where you tailored your message to a specific audience. How did you know what adjustments to make? How was it received by that audience?

title: Chief of Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview was a 25 minute panel interview with 3 panel members via Zoom. When interview was scheduled, there was no indication that it would be a panel. The interviewers were friendly and asked a standardized set of questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us what experience you have in fulfilling HR duties.

title: Structural Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Casual. They were very easy going and seemed like a good group to work with. The interview process was not stressful and their questions were not too abstract. Really enjoyed the group.
Interview Questions: Describe how you approach a challenging problem.

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: It was down to earth, a panel discussion and to the point. They made sure to ask questions that pertain to skills that they needed and it wasn't too long, but was important.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Student IT Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward. They just want to know you are a good worker and can follow directions. They asked questions about your education and a few job related questions that were pretty easy
Interview Questions: What is your education background and how is it related to the position

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of (virtual) interviews: first an interview with a committee and then a second interview with the direct supervisor. They asked typical non-technical interview questions. They did not provide contact information for thank yous or follow-ups.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with liberal arts education and what do you think of its value?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Very good. I was very impressed by the level of professionalism and poise by my interviewers. I felt confident in my answers and questions. I ended up getting the job.
Interview Questions: What would make you a good employee

title: Certified Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions asked by the manager. Questions consists of what are your strengths, and what do the words "health" and "fitness" mean to you. After the questions, a maximum of a week is waited before you are contacted about the position.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths/ tell me about yourself

title: Data Curator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed online where they talked about the program that we will be working with and the data server that we will be collecting the data from. It was overall very chill.
Interview Questions: What's you background? Why did you apply for this job?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Asked basic questions about the background areas of research, and teaching experience. Moreover, I was required to demonstrate my English proficiency, which went smooth. During the test, i was asked to teach on a given topic and have to speak 5 minutes non-stop.
Interview Questions: 1) What is your area of research? 2) Have you ever taught before? 3) Do you have any special preferences on subjects

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: It was good to me. It is a multi stop process. I think it is best to be prepared and to do your best. I think the interview process was not the hardest situation that I ever had.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to participate in a one-way interview where I could record responses to several questions. Next, I did a virtual interview with one department member, who passed me along to two additional interviews with three other members of the hiring committee.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Security Risk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two sets of interviews. The first one was meeting the team and round robin asking of behavioral questions. The second one was more of how you addressed problems in your previous workplace, results of previous projects, and included upper management and the CISO. They were both conducted over Zoom.
Interview Questions: How do you plan on supporting equity and inclusion?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was fast and easy. Not too difficult, and responded in a timely manner. Part of the process includes taking a video responding to questions, and then the video going to the employer
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The interview process as a whole was very professional and friendly from everyone who participated. Good questions and engagement and not too long.  I was able to ask questions that were answered.
Interview Questions: Interest in the position offered

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: After the application the recruiting lead asked me to respond to a few initial questions. A few days after I submitted my responses via email they responded saying that they would like to set up an interview, this took place over zoom with about 5 total people.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of something you accomplished at your last position that you were proud of

title: Grad Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with the department with a few of their staff. It was an easy conversation and flowed well. However, they were very cagey about compensation and refused to give me a number. By the time they gave it to me, I realized it was less than I was currently making and had to pull my application. It was a waste of all of our times, I wish they had just told me up front or when asked.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Senior Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: First round of interviews was with two MS Statisticians in the working group and one faculty for about an hour. They asked standard behavioral questions and some light technical background questions (e.g. What pieces of information would be important to know to do a power analysis?). Got an offer three days later with no second interview needed.
Interview Questions: What pieces of information would be important to know to do a power analysis?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Overall, the people were very kind and polite. We had a lot of genuine conversations about my past experiences and how I could leverage those into the new role as a research assistant. The people were very easygoing and overall I had a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: What were some obstacles I encountered in previous employment opportunities and how did I work to overcome them?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: 4 round of interview. First preliminary casual convo with hiring manager, then a formal interview with hiring manager, followed by meeting team members and finally meeting faculty members in the department.
Interview Questions:
Q: tell me about your background etc
Q: how will you be an expert and an asset to the faculty physicians.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Many  people on the interview for a less than minimum wage interview. Asked irrelevant questions. Did not specify details when I asked questions. Very chaotic experience. Took 2 weeks to get back to me and I had to follow up first to get a response.
Interview Questions: Asked how I stay organized

title: Employer Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was two interviews. Both took about 30 minutes - 1 hour to complete. They were virtual interviews and took place over the course of approximately 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your proudest achievement?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial interview with the director and a few other researchers. They respond very quickly. The second interview was a week after the first interview. However, they are only 40. minutes which made me feel rushed
Interview Questions: Tell me about your qualitative research experience. Tell me about your quantitative research experience. What is your ideal relationship with your supervisor? Tell me about a research project where you took the lead? Tell me about a research project that was difficult to work withz

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: It was a two interview process with a student lead and then an IT manager. Each lasted around 15 to 30 minutes with questions asking about experience and such. They also will tell you more about the position and what the role entails.
Interview Questions: What relevant experience do you have that pertains to this job?

title: Graduate Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: First round interview with hiring committee that included hiring manager, departmental HR person, and a future colleague. The meeting lasted about 45-50 minutes and consisted of fairly standard behavioral interview questions. The second round was 30 minutes with the directors of grad studies I would be working with and was less formal, more of a conversation.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you resolved a conflict at work.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Quick process and easy access for the next week or two months of work and your schedule has changed in my order and will not make you wanna tuitions but you type it
Interview Questions: I don’t think I need that much time for

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Online interview. You need to answer the interview question online and record a video. It has about 6 questions. You have two-time chances to answer the questions. Then you submitted the video.
Interview Questions: Tell about a process improvement you developed and implemented

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got an interview with a professor at UMN with a CV hands-on. He asked me several questions about my future career path and the project I would like to choose
Interview Questions: What do you want to do in future 10 years?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Interviewed with two people, both of with were directors of the organization. They asked questions about my background, why I was interested, pretty typical things. Was not difficult.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Data Breach Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: There is at least three rounds of interview which varies in length. The process was straight  forward and and relatively easy. The third round is kind a meeting  with top officers to check compatibility and how the candidate is suitable to the role.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you have to create a new process or improve one in order to solve a problem?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: I was sent an email inviting me to interview and then I interviewed through zoom. The interview process was pretty straightforward. They asked me about my experience and also why I was interested in the position.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience with administrative duties?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen with hiring manager followed by 1 hour zoom video interview with the entire team.
Some technical questions and some behavioral questions.
Mainly technical questions about sys admin type stuff.

Seems like they don't want to hire anyone that's qualified.  They want to hire someone that will conform to being vaccinated and following diversity initiatives.
Interview Questions: How do you embrace diversity and inclusion?

title: Service Desk Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first stage was a one-way video interview powered by Sparkhire where I had an unlimited amount of think time, three minutes to answer, and two takes for each question.
Interview Questions: When working with customers, what actions do you take to gain their confidence and trust?

title: District Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very thorough and very friendly. They explained questions I didn’t understand. Gave me time to answer the questions without feeling rushed or overwhelmed. Comfortable setting but was a little lengthy.
Interview Questions: Describing various scenarios on how you would handle different situations…

title: Executive Office & Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy. One way video interview and at least two rounds of video interviews with the department staff. The process to apply and interview for one job took almost two months.
Interview Questions: They asked the usual interview questions, primarily on previous experience and what skills would be brought to the current position.

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: They were really nice people. Interview environment was relax and comfortable but the tension was high. They ask really specific questions about my medical training and my reason to become resident at USA
Interview Questions: why are you choosing this program?

title: Computer Science TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: One behavioral round lasted for 30 minutes.  Asked about challenges faced and how to help students when they ask for help. Asked about I would deal with students at a disadvantage and how I would eliminate any implicit bias.
Interview Questions: Asked about how I would treat everyone fairly.

title: Computer Lab Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Pretty much easy going, regular interview. Basically went through the overview of the position and asked me general questions that are not that much challenging. There was only one interview I had to do and got an offer pretty much right after the interview via email.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: UGTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: It was a zoom interview, meeting with several employee leaders and they asked logical and behavioral questions. The questions were standard; they asked about my resume as well. I elaborated on my experiences.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Very good. The interview was straightforward and very easy. Just a couple of questions they asked me easy to answer. It was virtual so not in person, It was still good though even though it was virtual
Interview Questions: Time you worked in a team

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was easy. The process was not very lengthy. Questions were mostly behavioral. They responded very quickly. Had 2 rounds and they arranged both the meetings very timely and gave quick result.
Interview Questions: What are your three strengths?

title: Clinical Trail Monitor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: First interview with hiring manager and next a second interview with the clinical team and other clinical trial monitors. After successfully going through both interviews, I never was contacted about my standing.
Interview Questions:
Quick presentation of your resume and qualifications. What attracted you to apply for this position?
How do you work in a fast paced enviroment?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Had a 30-minute interview with 4 members of the department. I was told that the would be moving on to next steps in the following week or two, but I never heard back from anyone at the University regarding the job (it has been almost 2 months).
Interview Questions: They asked typical first interview questions.

title: Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Morris, MN) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I had a Zoom interview with the Morris campus graphic designer and senior director of institutional effectiveness 
and  the director of marketing and public relations from the Duluth campus. It was relatively uneventful and they were all professional and friendly.

I was a little put off that they strung me along for months after the interview without the courtesy of even sending an email. I emailed them three different times asking for word on the selection process, and only received an answer on my last email, more than a month and a half after the interview. THAT was not particularly professional.
Interview Questions: Very common PR questions. Nothing memorable. The usual "Why do you want to work at UMN Morris?" kind of thing.

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very standard. They asked some behavioral questions but overall wanted to make sure you would be a reliable and good worker. The questions were not too hard and they only asked a few, then they asked about your work experience.
Interview Questions: What would you do if there was a conflict in the building, how would you handle it

title: Student IT Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very laid back interview. Asked about my interests and how i would handle different situations. the interview was only 20 mins. They offered me the position at the end.
Interview Questions: How would you ensure privacy when working remotely.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: it was simple. No complexities at all. Interviews were well scheduled and got timely response. Although lots of interviews were done but finally they decided on an university internal employee.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength and weakness?

title: Digital Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a group of 8 people who asked me questions and reviewed my portfolio. The questions ranged from serious to funny.  They also asked me to talk about the projects that I've worked on in the past.
Interview Questions: If you were a superhero, which one would you be?

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: All communication before and after the interview was timely and professional. I do wish they would have told me what stage of interview we were in, as they didn't do a prescreen. I also wish they would have told me the interview attendees.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with DEI?

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The manager emailed me to schedule a 1 on 1 interview and it was a very relaxing interview process, and asked some experience-related and behavioral questions. They emailed me after four days that you are hired.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time that you overcome from the conflict and how do you feel?

title: Executive and Office Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: It was the traditional process of a phone interview followed by a video(Zoom) interview. Additional references were requested, and then a position was offered. In total, the process took 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize tasks?

title: CSCI Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: No technical questions. No need to practice leet code for such an interview. Just explain why you would be a good TA and answer some questions about inclusion and diversity.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good TA?

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview with minimal questions. The job didn't require much experience for the position so the questions were about general work ethic. It was only a 20 minute phone call interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with data entry?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was a bit informal. No coding interview. Questions were behavioral and more high-level discussions about technology, the development process, and work styles. They also discussed some of the challenges the school was facing and how they planned to address it technologically.
Interview Questions: What are the benefits of using containers? How would you explain it to me if I were 5 years old?

title: Senior Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Disorganized, they clearly have no idea what they are looking for. Too many people involved, panel clearly unqualified and uninformed about role. Job is very poorly paid, as are most UofM jobs, but they are looking for an extraordinarily experienced and skilled candidate.
Interview Questions: Please Tell us about yourself

title: Front End Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions:
First interview: phone screening with lead developer

Second interview: met with various directors and was given a problem to solve before the interview.  During the interview they asked how I would solve the problem and was asked to walk them through my thought process. I was given no immediate feedback on my answer.
Interview Questions: They asked about relevant experience, asked some behavioral questions, and also asked specifically how I would solve the example problem

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Applied using guidelines on website. Important to indicate professors and areas that match your research interests and explain why you want to join grad school. References from other professors are also important
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be there? What your career goals?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very well, thank you very much for asking me. I enjoyed it and think that they asked easy questions that I could find answers to with ease.
Interview Questions: What is you greatest strength?

title: Multimedia Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Lack of communication. I went through 2 rounds of interviews, one in person and one remotely. I followed up was finally told that I didn’t get the position. The staff seemed nice, but the follow up was disheartening. I get the feeling that your interview experience depends on the department that you are interviewing with.
Interview Questions: How do you incorporate diversity and inclusion in your process?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Good. Just talk with the professor and everything is fine. It depends on how well you are familiar with your professor and your field. Just keep me normal and stay professional.
Interview Questions: Do you think you can handle the work?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Just sit down. That’s it. Just talked with professor about the class I’d be helping with and how I was supposed to grade and run it. Overall pretty chill. Just make sure you talk about liking teaching.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite part of the body?

title: Clinical Research Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: They asked a question as to how I deal with a difficult supervisor. They wanted to find out my through process. They wanted to know the days I would be available to work. It seemed that they had predetermined days and not open to flexibility.
Interview Questions: Talk about difficult patient or supervisor

title: Grants Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: two  interviews took place. the first interview was a bit easier and shorter, more of a screening. the second interview was longer and had more challenging behavioral/experience-related questions. the process took one week
Interview Questions: how do you handle challenges or difficulty in your current job?

title: Dental School Communication Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
initial phone interview 5 minutes: why do you want to work for us and what is your salary?

After receiving a second interview (via Zoom) which lasted for one hour I was never contacted. I had to reach out to them after two weeks and their response was that there must have been a "hiccup" with getting back to me. I prepared for hours for this interview and was shocked by their lack of empathy, kindness, and mismanagement. 

Hiring supervisor appeared very young and perhaps in over her head. She asked how I would "manage up" which after reviewing with associates later I understood to be how do you manage your manager. I do my job and I expect them to do theirs.

Perhaps not getting this job was a blessing.
Interview Questions:
How do you manage up?

Tell me about a time when you didn't succeed at work?

What do you do when you make a mistake?

What is the difference between identity and brand?

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Showed up and asked me questions about whether or not I would be able to do the job. Was able to accurately answer with a definitive yes or no to each question
Interview Questions: Can you map a network drive

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: I submitted the application and got reply in a week. The interview is conducted by the professor and it's straightforward, just some mostly asked questions. They will also inform you the details about the position. Don't hesitate to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. / Why are you interested in the position?

title: Student Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Simple and easy, very laid back, always looking for the right people who are looking to get some job experience with an on campus position. Typically get back to you within a day or two of the interview depending on whether they would like to offer you the position.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about a time you had to resolve an issue with a co-worker or team member.

title: Student Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: One question: when can you start. Super easy but probably also depends on who is conducting the interview. No need to get super dressed up before or prepare. Should go pretty smoothly for anyone
Interview Questions: What days are you able to work?

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process starts with an exploratory phone interview with the hiring committee.  Multiple interviews with administration, other faculty, and students.  Required to give a teaching presentation to the university community to based on a topic of your choice.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching style?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, given Covid-19. Very short, pleasant. I asked if I had any questions that led into more discussion about the position. Seemed very flexible for another summer internship I had.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with social media and stats

title: Finance Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Formal interview with 19 questions that checks your experience level. Some of them had sub questions.  The questions were basic . Compliance monitoring  and enforcement . obtaining info  from a contact when they dont respond in a timely fashion
Interview Questions: How do you promote diversity and inclusion

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: They accept you before the interview, so the interview process is more a benefit for you to choose a team to join. This is not a stressful interview, they put you at a hotel and take you to a chain brewery.
Interview Questions: What drives you?

title: Student Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Just sat down with them and talked. We discussed what they do and how the job is done. We then went on to discuss why my skills work well in this work environment.
Interview Questions: How do you feel qualified for this job

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Job posting - Apply - Wait for a week - Interview - Accepted - Approval - Paper work
This is almost all of the explanation about my job processing. It was not too hard to get a job here as a student intern.
Interview Questions: What is your strengths working as Intern?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application. Then if you were qualified you were asked back for an interview. The interview took place in-person, with just one person. The person was who your future supervisor will be. Really relaxed and stress-free environment. Fairly easy interview questions. I was offered the position within a week.
Interview Questions: Weaknesses

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Very quick. Couple of phone calls and an in person interview. Was quite informal for most of it. Mainly went based off of your application. Hiring depends upon the funding that they have available, so you may be a great candidate but they just don't have the funding right then.
Interview Questions: If I was interested in doing a PhD.

title: Student Development Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met the recruiter at a school career fair, after talking to her and submit an application I got contacted for an interview. It was a one-round interview with about 8 questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you took initiative

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Could not even find the building cause of the 9 different constructions going on and I had arrived almost 40 minutes early.  If the whole front of your building is being replaced you might want to give the person interviewing a heads up so they are aware.  The HR dept would not let me reschedule.  Totally ridiculous and HR won't even communicate with you, sending you scripted responses.  Don't you dare think for a second you were going to get inside the impenetrable fortress that is the U of MN!
Interview Questions: Where is the building I am supposed to interview in??!?!!?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Standard process for academic interviews. It takes 2 days. One presentation, 10 - 15 one on one meetings. The good thing is that people are really nice in the whole interview process
Interview Questions: Questions are about your research.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Received an interview invite after submitting the job application.
The interview was straight-forward. Explained the research project I was working on and gave some examples as to how I can apply my current skillsets in the job I'm applying.
Interview Questions: What was the role of DTI (Diffusion tensor imaging) in the biophysical modeling of deep brain stimulation that I was building?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions:
a phone interview. You presented your works. They asked questions in your presentation.
Then they told you what they were doing. The main questions are about your research and related projects. Not so difficult because they did not ask detailed questions but the big picture.
Interview Questions: some questions related to your slides

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Excellent interview process. Great team. Very personable. I was able to meet the team and everyone I would work with. Quick from interview to hire.  Turned out to be everything I expected it to be.  Great manager, staff team.
Interview Questions: Plan for next 5 years

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: There were basic behavioral questions. It lasted about 30 minutes. It can go for longer if you wanted your answers to be more detailed, but concise answers are probably better.
Interview Questions: If the phone rang, a patron requesting to check out books, and another patron wanting to print but printer is jammed, in what order would you complete first and why?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Very good, a lot of questions, very energetic, great environment, difficult to no to offers, a very good place to in the city, friendly people, very helpful, need to work hard though
Interview Questions: General question with some specific ones related to the previous work

title: Classroom Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: really quick and easy, they asked a lot of questions about my experiece and stuff ive done with classroom equipment in the past. overall it was very easy and id highly recommend working here
Interview Questions: What is some of your past work experience?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very quick interview process from start to finish. Applied on line and had the interview over the phone a few days later. Was able to start two weeks after phone interview.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Was a multi-step process. I lived out of state so it began with a skype interview and then narrowed down candidates. I was then called for an on campus interview. This part was extensive. I met with the head coach, senior administrators, the athletic director, the vice chancellor of student affairs, as well as athletes.  Important to note this was at the Morris campus.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with coaching

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: They'll have you come for interview with the faculty and to meet some of the students. Important to ask the students about their experiences in the labs, and to ask the faculty about their research
Interview Questions: Talk about your research experience?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straightforward and standard for an interview process. Did not take long and was very normal. Other than that, that is about it in regards to the interview.
Interview Questions: How do you define success

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: only behavioral Qs, not too complex, since you must show professionalism, and persistence to learning new skills, they will be motivated to have you. Also, very friendly environment and a good induction process.
Interview Questions: What 5 words your friends will define on you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Was asked to come in the lab and interview it was easy for the most part work had to do with big data and data mining in some cases take home projects are given to assess your candidacy
Interview Questions: How do you run market basket on an unsupervised model

title: Senior Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, then a first round interview with a panel. Second Round interview was with the dean and the second half was with a panel of current academic advisors.
Interview Questions: My experiences and what I can bring to the department. A lot of typical academic advising questions.

title: Financial Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Generally, most departments will have a three step process. First, an hour interview by a committee with a set of questions asked to all applicants. Second, a follow-up interview for only the best applicants. Questions will be more specific and candidates who try to bluff their way through will be discovered. The third will be a final interview with the hiring authority who may make an offer. Realize that the Search Committee will have talked extensively with the hiring authority. References will be contacted between the first and second interviews in many searches. If the candidate is a current or former U employee, personnel records will be checked. There is a free flow of information within the University. A former supervisor is free to divulge literally anything about the applicant.
Interview Questions: The University is in the top ten of research institutions receiving federal grants. Most interviews will bring up the applicant’s knowledge and experience of Federal rules and how they are applied.

title: Visit Relations Representative-Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty informal and personal. It was relaxed while still professional. They are trying to get a feel of your personality and involvements on campus. It also helps if you’re a good story teller and can elaborate on personal experiences.
Interview Questions: What are you involved in on campus?

title: Student Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is very informal. Not many technical questions, only questions about experiences and interests in order to find a project you will enjoy. However, you must be sure that the project you are assigned to is one that you will enjoy because I spent the whole summer working on only one project.
Interview Questions: What area of Computer Science are you interested in?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held at PI's office. It was a relaxing and inspiring process, in which I was given enough time to explain my desires and needs. All the discussion and negotiation process went smooth and straightforward. Both of us feel efficient during the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your career goal?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really easy. It was mostly about the background knowledge and past jobs. Ver easygoing people and flexible with time. They usually get back to you within a week. It is good to be able to relate to the job you are applying for and talk about what makes you a good candidate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous job

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: phone interview first, followed by 2 in-person interviews on separate days with various members of the team/management going over job description and skills assessment. followed by offer letter presented through the HR department
Interview Questions: availability

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview which went well, then an in-person interview with two managers who were in town. Considering I drove an hour to meet them, spent 4 hours putting together a presentation, and paid $20 to park for this interview, I would have appreciated some follow up, even if it was just to tell me I didn’t get the job. There was no communication after that point.
Interview Questions: How would you recruit students from a warm weather climate to a school like Minnesota?

title: Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two in-person interviews. The first interview was with my direct supervisor and the second was with her direct supervisor. They both lasted approximately 30 minutes. I offered to drive to Minneapolis for both interviews. The interview process was pleasant.
Interview Questions: Are you more of an independent worker or do you like to work with a team?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, just wanted to get to know who I was. Asked basic behavioral questions but did not seem to worried about my ability to complete the job. I was referred, this may be why they seemed extra lenient. Overall, very good experience.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stressful situations?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Interview was straightforward and track-record oriented. I had to demonstrate skills on site, took a test, had one on one interview, an audition. A very  comprehensive experience. I also had the opportunity to meet the peers that are already working there.
Interview Questions: Q: What is a strength of yours?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: applied online ..... they took long time to get back to me for the interview. the interview took hours overall. they are not organized asking same questions. I don't know what is the point of meeting such a big group for a small position.
Interview Questions:
- your strengths
- your weaknesses
- how do you manage projects

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: basic questions. between 3 to 5 people interviewing you and through out the whole time they were trying to make me feel comfortable and  keep the interview going. nice environment
Interview Questions: like where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back directly from the hiring manager within 2 weeks for an interview. The interview was standard for a student position focused on your academic interests, future career goals, skills you are looking to gain, etc.
Interview Questions: What is your major and what do you intend to do with your degree?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: They are relaxed and easy going. Asked very general interview questions. They are very responsive and look to connect with you. Be prepared to have general answers during the interview process.
Interview Questions: How well do you work independently ?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty formal. Wear business casual. Smile and appear interested in the position. The hiring manager might have one other person in the room with you. You can expect basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weakness?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: One day interview process including meeting with faculty/grad students and postdocs, within and outside the department. You are expected to give a one hour seminar on your PhD work. Meetings involve your expectations about the job and what you can deliver.  They are also interested in long term plans.
Interview Questions: What are my long term plans?

title: Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
In-person, group interview. I was provided with a couple of technical questions that lacked context. The team seemed incredibly paranoid about discussing their environment. I don't know anyone that would take a job without knowing what the environment is like beforehand. Eventually I was able to figure out the job was just looking at logs all day, rather than developing and testing security solutions as claimed by the job description.

Almost all of their questions were stereotypical of an interview: "How do you work with others?", "How do you deal with conflict?", "Give me an example of a time when you X or Y." It reminded me of the interviews I would have back in high-school when working as a cashier, retail associate, etc.
Interview Questions:
<given a sheet of paper with some context-less data>
 "Tell me from a security perspective what is wrong with this?"

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple just like any student worker interview would be. Especially for a position as easy and common sense full as this one. the manager was interested in learning about me as a person and not just as an employee
Interview Questions: what my goals were as a studen

title: OpenVMS Systems Admn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview I had was an ambush.  A room full of interviewers and me.  I would have handled the interview better from my perspective by informing my host that it would not be my way of inviting a guest into my "home".
Interview Questions: It was the questions that did NOT pertain to the job discription that were "out of taste".

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very hectic and was late to start. I felt like I did less talking than the interviewer and as it was only scheduled for a half hour, I left feeling like I knew very little about the position. I was disappointed that the hiring person never followed up as to the job progress even after I emailed more than once. I'm not even sure the position was ever filled.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Software Engineer(Internship) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then I got an email to schedule an interview. I met with the  two managers, and we went through my resume and talked about if my experience fits the job. It was about half an hour.
Interview Questions: how to manage time when you have conflict tasks

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and cover letter directly to the hiring manager after being informed they were looking for additional tutors in my field of study. I was contacted by the hiring manager and asked to come in for an interview. I interviewed in person with only the hiring manager. It was professional yet relaxed, and we had a good conversation. He offered me the position by the end of the interview, which lasted approximately 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Explain to me, who knows nothing about engineering, the basic concepts of statics, as if I were a student taking the course and needing help.

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very relaxed. It comprised of a few competency questions that involved dealing with upset customers and your reactions. It was easy-going and the response time was quick.
Interview Questions: Name a time that you had to deal with an upset customer and how did you deal with it?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Phila, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lengthly, took several steps to get to meet the hiring manager. Phone screening was pretty tough. Overall it was pretty interesting to go through the process I had to. I would reccomend trying the process for experience in doing such
Interview Questions: What is your weakness

title: 4-H Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Rochester, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with Youth Development Office on campus. Then with the county needed the position presented a 15 min PP on how to grow progam. Finally answered 12 questions from a panel of community and staff involved with local 4-H
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child was going into the show ring not standing next to an adult handler as required?

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was conducted by a person with terrible accent. Could not understand the questions he asked. I had to ask him to repeat the questions 4 times, then I just started guessing.  Requested another phone interview. The group panel was OK. The questions asked could be found online.
Interview Questions: Describe how you work on a project

title: Assistant Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very casual. I was brought to the office of my soon to be manager where her and another of my bosses asked me questions. I then was given a workplace tour and got to talk to different employees. They then brought me back to the office and basically said they would hire me and told me what paperwork I needed to fill out.
Interview Questions: What else are you involved in on campus?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview was given by the student first then in person interview was given by the manager.
The phone interview was more about information.
The inperson one is some how tricky. They asked me what if customer found that they cant open facebook page. Or what if they found their chrome frozen
Interview Questions: if you have a baby elephant how will you decorate it during the Halloween

title: Assistant Professor of History Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a campus interview that was preceded by an interview via Skype. In both I had to account for my current and future research interests, broader trends in the field in which I was situated, as well as classes I would teach at the undergraduate and graduate level.
Interview Questions: What kind of classes could you envision teaching in the History department?

title: Graduate Studies Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal, really it had more to do with the professors you knew and the courses you were taking. The job was created as a way to give experience to current students, not necessarily to overload them with menial tasks.
Interview Questions: How would this position help further your knowledge of your studies or your success as a student?

title: Desktop Support Professional - OIT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very slow.  It took them over two months to respond to my application. You need to look perfect on paper for them to even consider you.  I thought my interview went very well, but wasn't offered the position.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: In person interview that was very basic.  Asked questions that are easily found off the internet about different behavioral situations.  Answer in STAR form.  Lasted around 45 minutes at the most.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Academic Technology Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: The HR recruiter arranged a panel interview with about 8 people who worked in the technology department. The recruiter was personable and helpful, but the team manger was a condescending a-hole during the interview who cut me off mid-sentence repeatedly to challenge my credentials. It was so bad I withdrew my application after it was over. I had a much more welcoming interview with another department at the university.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a conflict you've had at work and how you resolved it.

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a response within a day or two to come in for an in-person interview. The interview was with two people from the team. It lasted about 30 minutes. I got an offer two days later.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself.

title: Parking Lot Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by the staff and had a quick interview a few days later. Lasted about 10 minutes, asked 3 standard interview questions and then was told we'd be in contact.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions - Imagine a time when you were stressed at work, how did you handle it

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really laid back and conversational. It was mostly a matter of finding someone to fill a certain time spot so it only took one interview and then filling out some paperwork to complete the process. It's a really great job by the way.
Interview Questions: Q: Are you available to work the morning shift?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minn City, MN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview initially lasting for 15 minutes. Then was called in for an in-person interview which lasted for 30 minutes. Took about 2 weeks to hear back from them with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience with research?

title: Student Athlete Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied, got an interview within a few days, if you can show you are responsible, respectful and knowledgeable of college level academic topics you should get a call back.  Although when I applied they had specifically sent out emails saying they needed tutors.
Interview Questions: Asked me to explain a fake homework question as if the interviewer was a student.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was a series of Skype interviews as a was in a different country and the PI did not want to pay for travel. Presentations were of work/previous projects - the usual. 
Then what the project could look like in this position.
Interview Questions: The usual questions of project details

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: They were very accommodating. The questions were thorough but fair. It was the longest interview I have had to do, but it helped me get a feel for the kind of work I would be doing in that position.
Interview Questions: Name two strengths you wish you had.

title: Accounting III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: A panel interview with four people.  They all very nice and making the interview process goes very smooth.   They explain about the role and expectation of this job.  They also take me for a tour of the department.  Everyone there seems very nice.
Interview Questions:
What you like and dislike about your current job?
What is your long-term goal?
Do you have experience in grant accounting experience; excel spreadsheet, other computer programs?
Explain your biggest accomplishment?
Explain a time when you handle stress?

title: Computer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
2 interviews, initial interview was pleasant and the interviewers were friendly and easy to get along with. 
2nd interview introduced the hiring manager. He was not as friendly - made me very uncomfortable, did not laugh or smile, and presented as very condescending and unpleasant. 
First interview were very general questions about your personality and work experience. Second interview, they had a computer that they wanted you to set up and trouble shoot. The issue ended up being that one of the sticks of RAM were bad, however the computer gave no beep codes when starting up that would indicate this. 
The computer was also a new design which I had not seen before - was very difficult to take apart and then put back together with everyone watching you.  Definitely the worst interview experience of my life, and I left feeling badly and pretty humiliated - the hiring manager's attitude towards me did not help at all. After that, I would not have wanted to work there even if the job was offered to me. 
I was sent a letter via snail mail stating that they were not offering me the position.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you experienced positive and negative customer service
Situational questions ie. You have to deal with a crisis but are stopped by a coworker who needs help - what do you do?
What experience do you have with Mac computers
How would you stop a program from launching on start up?

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very long at least 3 months with 3 phases ( 1 survey, 2 face to face) and another face to face with the VP of IT. applied for the job then got a competency survey and after was called for 1 round of interview and 2nd round and then after meeting with the IT VP
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you have to convey technical information to a non-technical audience

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was quick and professional. I met the senior researcher, PI and human resources person for the onsite interview. The interview last about an hour. However, this depend on your lab, PI and department.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background, research interest. It is mainly to see if you are a good fit for the position

title: Finance Professional II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. First one more general, second interview deals with problem solving and listing of professional accomplishments. Interview process was very organized and the hiring manager was helpful in communicating needs of the role
Interview Questions: How do you deal with working in a diverse environment?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: After completing a questionnaire I was asked to come in for an interview.  The first qualification should be your requested salary before they send you their questionnaire. This would be more practical and could potentially save the candidate and the interviewers time if salary didn't fit within the budget.  I was interviewed by two managers and an office manager. The interview process was polite and their were no technical questions asked. They stressed diversity in the questionnaire as well as the interview.
Interview Questions: Diversity is very important here at the U, how would you continue to foster diversity...

title: Student Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by Alumni Relations Director and Marketing Director, they are super fun, nice and casual about it. They know you are a student so they aren't too harsh on you but you should be prepared to answer questions relating to why the rec is important to you and what kind of message you want to get out on campus.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Rec

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Extremely easy to set up and meet with the interviewer. Just had to apply online. No back channels or anything. Told me what was expected of me at the interview. Initial phone interview and then an in person interview. They ask about your personality and work style.
Interview Questions: How do I work in a team environment.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The person who called me for the interview did not state the job title. This was confusing for me because I had applied for several positions. When I called back to ask, she gave a job title for a position I had never applied to. It was difficult for me to prepare for the interview without seeing a job description.
Interview Questions: How would your current experience help you succeed in this role?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: In the interview, you need to give (1) a presentation of the previous work and then have (2) discussions about the research projects you need to participate. They will introduce the background knowledge of the projects, and ask some technical questions related to the projects.
Interview Questions: the questions focused on the research projects I have conducted.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: One hour departmental seminar, describing my current research and outlining my interest in the department (45 minutes talk plus 15 minutes for questions). The seminar was followed by the full day conversations with senior lab members and principal investigator, typically between 30-45 minutes per person. Contacted the PI a fortnight after the interview, and got the offer soon afterwards.
Interview Questions: Specifics relating to my research

title: Senior Office and Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: The first step is a brief phone interview to confirm availability and interest in the position after a brief discussion of job duties and pay range. Next, a 1:1 interview with the hiring authority is completed where more information about the position is provided along with information about the culture and day-to-day business. Finalists are invited back for group interviews with 3-5 people from the unit. My group interview included key stakeholders who would interact frequently with the position. I found that only one of the four people in my interview was adequately prepared. The most senior member in the interview hadn't looked at my application materials and asked me irrelevant questions like why I had left my previous positions in less than one year. It was documented that all of my positions save one had been held for 2-3 years and only terminated because of relocation. The most recent position had been a temporary contract position that I held for the six months leading up to my application to the University.
Interview Questions: Describe your process for dealing with a difficult client or dissatisfied customer.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: I was admitted as a graduate student. I did not undergo an interview per se. This review is not applicable to my situation. Staff matched me to research assistant and teaching assistant positions every semester and there was no interview. I have nothing I can put in this space. I can see how this form would give valuable insight into most employment situations, but not this one.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got a call to schedule an interview from the lab PI about two months after I applied for the job, and interviewed the next week. Then I was asked to supply my references and once those got to the PI he offered me the job the next day.
Interview Questions: What did you do when you were in a situation where you hated the person you had to do work with?

title: Postdoctoral Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Austin, MN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
3 PIs and 1 HR officer conducted the interview. Got asked about my technical skills, academic performance, possible start dates and relationships with lab members.
Since I did my PhD in developmental biology lab and the job was in a cancer research lab, I got asked why do I want to make the switch. Further to this the PI asked if I had read his publications.
Interview Questions: Do you get along with your lab member?

title: Payroll Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Sit down in the office and answer formal questions. It was a very relaxed feel and I felt comfortable in their office. They closed doors, so that it wasn't in a cube setting. The questions were written down on a sheet of paper and she didn't write down any answers. There was no desk between us.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took several weeks to hear regarding this position (as with many of the roles at the University of Minnesota).  After hearing from the group, it took a couple of weeks to set up an interview for the position, but for this role there was only 1 interview - a group panel.
Interview Questions: Tell us about how you approached a project and your results

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy process, there was a panel that interviewed me and then on to the Faculty advisor.  They let me know pretty quickly if I got the job, and I got a sense in the room that it was going well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Human Resource Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: A pool of over 50 applicants. I was an internal candidate, considered valuable to my department. Almost 6 months after position was posted, got phone interview. Many, many weeks later, panel interview with 6 people with 3 missing so I'd have to interview with them separately. Next day job was re-posted (for better pool). Learned in passing that in less than 3 weeks, they hired someone.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minn City, MN) in Dec 2015
