Interview Descriptions: General Interview with question related to job, The overall interview was good however not a very good fit. I would look to see if there were other opportunities as well that better fit my experience.
Interview Questions: Why do want to work for UM?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
It was October 2015, I was applying for PhD Graduate Schools. I emailed a Computer Science research lab that I was interested in and asked the PI if it's possible to schedule a meeting with him. The PI replied me quickly and we scheduled a meeting the following week. He was very satisfied with my resume. I expressed my interest working for the lab the following spring semester and my interest in becoming a PhD student in the lab.
He told me he would keep an eye for my application when it came in but that he can't promise anything at that time. However, around December he told me there shouldn't be any problem letting me in!
Interview Questions: Whtat's my past research experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. Open communication. Felt comfortable at the end of the interview whether I had the job or not. Emails with questions were returned more slowly than I would have wished by the recruiter after an offer was made.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience and why you feel you are qualified for this position.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a first interview with four people from several departments that interact with the position. They asked two questions each. They were good, thoughtful questions. They told me they would let me know either way about a second interview but they never did. I emailed a month later and was told the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: How do you get along with editors?

title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about a week later I received an email asking to set up an interview. Interview took place over the phone since I lived abroad. Needed to complete a second interview so another person could ask me questions. But on the first interview, they asked what they needed to do to get me there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Researcher I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: They were very flexible (I was briefly living out of state when I interviewed for this position). It was fairly informal with the faculty I would be working with and with the head of the experiment station I'd be located. I had an on campus interview and one at the experiment station.
Interview Questions: How long are you wanting to stay in your next position?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: After the workshop, you may or may not be asked for an interview.  They ask mostly about how you would handle certain situations or what you have done in the past.
Interview Questions: What was a time you disagreed with someone of superior position and what did you do?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Interview weekend involved meeting with three faculty members of your choice along with social events with the current graduate students. We were given a tour of the facilities at the campus and a seminar by the faculty describing their key research areas.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in joining UMN? Which particular faculty's work interests you? Describe your previous work experience?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: First interview was at the main campus, second interview at county office.  Group interview for both interviews.  Had to do a presentation to the interviewing panel.
Interview Questions: There was a presentation you had to present to 3-10 people.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Unprofessional, Didn't seem to care. Went on for a while but was just them trying to fill up space in the interview. Just like I am for this review no one cares about.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the University of Minnesota.

title: Junior Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job online, was emailed a pre-interview questionnaire with technical questions about the job. Based on my answers, I was invited for an interview. Interview was a panel with 3 people who asked questions from a list and wrote my answers. The interview took about an hour. Following the interview, I received an email that said " Your interview went well and we are considering hiring you for one of our two position. We would now like to ask you for references.". My references let me know that they were indeed contacted and gave good reviews. 10 days after the reference request, I got an email from the director apologizing for the delay and telling me ("Dear Interviewee") that the department had received another grant and that dealing with it was causing some delay in hiring for this position, but soon they would be able to refocus on hiring and he would keep me posted. Never heard from these people again after that email. No rejection, no response either way. I felt like this was a huge waste of my time and I wish they didn't bother my references if they weren't serious about hiring me. I would be wary of ever interviewing with this organization again.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous experience using MRI machines.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with principal investigator and professors funding the research. Typical interview, lasted one hour. Offer was made on the spot. I had to deliver two research presentations. One presentation was made to a group of professors and lab principal investigators. The second presentation was made to a group of graduate school students.
Interview Questions: Questions were about my previously published work.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was for the position to be the division administrator for Gastroenterology, Hepatology and Nutrition. Applied online and got an interview. It was a panel interview with HR, current GI physician, two different administrators and the interview only lasted about an hour or so. I was told there are three rounds total. Second round is with more people and final round is with the department head. I didn't get invited to move forward. My experience is only with first round of interviews. The questions were all situation based. More on team building and very high emphasis on problem solving. All types of problems: people, technology, grant etc. be prepare to come in with examples of how you solve problems.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your grant experience

title: Principal Accounts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was about 45 minutes long in a conference room.  This was a one on one interview and a fairly casual and laid back event.  The interviewer was very kind and conversational.  They ended up hiring another candidate but I appreciated that they got back to me (other people might disagree).  I thought I was in the running for the position and I know they called one of my references.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult co-worker?

title: Brand Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to give a presentation on my experience within my field, and then was asked a series of follow up questions regarding my experience and ideas I had for the position's strategy.
Interview Questions: Who do you think our most important audiences are?

title: Info Tech Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: they had a group to see if I would fit the feel of the group, then group for technical knowledge with a white board demo of past work that I had done
Interview Questions: Show samples of work

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: LONG. THe interview process, like most processes at the university, is incredibly slow. Expect it to take at least a month from being offered an interview to being offered a job.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Nightmarish website. The usual nonsense of having to answer endless questions already answered in your resume. Terrible web interface. Best advice - copy and paste the requirements into the job answers so that all the keywords are picked up by the computer, otherwise it will throw away your application unread. How I got through the preliminary process to get an interview I'll never know.
Interview Questions: Name a problem you had on the job and how you addressed it.

title: Student Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Morris, MN)
Interview Descriptions: You must be working for the residential life already as a Community Advisor.  You get offered the chance to apply during the latter half of the fall semester. You need to fill out the online application.  Once filled out, you will be prompted to sign up online for an interview time during winter training for current community advisors.  You are given around 45 minutes for an interview.  It is possible to finish the interview in 20 minutes.  Expand on your answers using past experiences working in residential life.  Once the interview is complete, you will be asked if you have any questions about the role.
Interview Questions: How would you identify a communication breakdown on your staff and how would you rectify it?

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: A full time position was created for me because I showed that I was invaluable as a student intern. I still had to submit my resume, cover letter, and work samples and proceeded with an interview with my supervisor. The entire process took about a week until I received a phone call with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Define diversity and explain ways in which you design and communicate to a diverse audience.

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went to a walk in interview for the position after submitting a resume. The interview was a combination of a one on one and a group (2 or 3 interviewers).  I was then notified by email and phone call that I had received the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to calm down someone who was upset and angry.

title: Usability Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple. The questions didn't seem difficult and were only asked to assess schedule and interest fit. As a student interested in pursuing the field of technical communications and usability, it seemed as if they were inclined to give me the job based on my appreciation for the position.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to get out of this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: By far the most difficult and intimidating interview I have ever had. Panel of other office employees and hiring representative asked several very challenging questions without revealing much about the position. Very organized and very to the point. Committee also did not give away if the answers given were to their liking or not. Interview process with more than one interview.
Interview Questions: What types of managers do you not work well with? When has your confidentiality been tested?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I talked to my advisor, Dr. Bin He. He asked for my resume, and we talked about my past research experience. After the conversation, he asked me to give a short presentation during a lab meeting
Interview Questions: How does your experience translate to this position?

title: Bookstore Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, basic questions. Got the interview because I knew a girl who works there and she recommended me. Asks about prior experience in retail, your availability and other things along that line.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous retail experience

title: Smart Learning Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took me to a room and asking several behavior questions, especially on the past experience related to tutoring. She also asked me how this position can help me achieve my career goal. What are the classes you have taken. Do you have any questions?
Interview Questions: How much do you know about smart learning?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview followed by an in person interview with the PI two days after submitting my application. The interview process was standard, with the PI asking about my previous experience, my research interests, and my experiences with software/analysis.
Interview Questions: What software packages have you used for statistical analysis?

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and easy. Very nice manager who asked personal life questions basically to see if you fit in with the other staff and students who work there.  Took maybe 10 minutes and you'll start training as soon as you are available for it.
Interview Questions: Asked about retail experience.

title: Community Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 5 weeks. I applied online and got a call about two weeks after. Went through two in-person interviews. The first one was with three supervisors, who I would be working under if I was to get the position. The second interview was with a PI and one of the supervisors from the first interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Was lucky to have a connection for the position. I submitted by application and interviewed within the next 2 weeks and was notified of my hire within the next week. Quick turn-around.
Interview Questions: How would you use what you've learned and apply it to this position?

title: Extension Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (West Saint Paul, MN) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Recieved a phone call for a time to interview. Interviewed in front of 7 people and had to do a 10 minute presentation. There were University of MN staff and local county commissioners.
Interview Questions: What populations are high needs for financial education?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews; one with a cross-team panel and one with management. The cross-team panel included engineers, designers and project managers, and seemed more like a screening for vetos. 

The management interview more like an in-depth "here's what we're doing here - are you interested?" conversation, with a look to the future, which was great.

One weird thing was that the hiring manager, who was part of the cross-team interview, seemed to have almost nothing to do with the actual work. That might be part of the management structure at the U, but it caught me off-guard.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to move to a more technical position?

title: IT Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The application and phone interview process was normal. The interview itself went well and I received several compliments. It appears they were unprepared and did not read all of my resume. They were just going through the whole file as they interview progressed. As soon as the noticed I was veteran they came very distant, curt, and wrapped up the interview.
Interview Questions: The standard HR and IT questions.

title: Honors Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Students are initially recruited through emails from administrative staff. Generally, sophomore, junior, and senior honors students are recruited for research. Moreover, a list of projects, the professors involved, and a description of each project are provided to all applicants. All participants needed to do was write a statement indicating your interest in different research projects, and attach one's resume.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the projects you chose?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: 45-Minute phone interview. The supervisor was very particular about what the job entailed and made it clear the kind of person she need; someone hardworking and with a good attitude. It was very important to her that the peoples hired where not in it only for the money.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this position?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Few letters of recommendations from former mentors qualified me for this position as they were acquaintances with the PI. It took 2 weeks after initial contacts to receive an offer and paperwork from the HR.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Junior Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very simple interview with the lab section head. The questions were very basic personality questions, and was followed by a tour of the lab. I was called within 3 days to inform me that I would be receiving an offer.
Interview Questions: What are some qualities that make a good manager.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring interview consisted only on exchanging emails with potential PI. I think this would be different for each post doctoral positions, and sometimes it required to bring in some funding.
Interview Questions: Specific questions about the research project I worked on during my Ph.D.

title: IT Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application through the school's career page and got an invite to an interview a few days later. Interviewed directly with my supervisor where he asked mostly behavioral and "what would you do in this situation" type of questions. No technical questions at all.
Interview Questions: What would you do if there was an IT problem during one of your classes and no one was around?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through official website, talked to future advisor through Skype before coming. My advisor is quite easy-going and didn't have too many questions since I don't speak English as first language. I received offer within 3 months
Interview Questions: To what extent do you understand my research area

title: Graduate Research Assistant PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: telephone interview. two professors vs me. questioned about previous research experiences, research interests, how did I know about UofM, long term career goal. very relaxed atmosphere, lasted about 20~30 minutes. get offer letter the next day of the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Applied through online system. Got an phone interview in 1 month. the phone talk is within 10 mins. Mainly about my previous research experience. The interviewer is pretty nice, no tricky questions, pretty informal talk. I think that the phone interview is mainly about testing my communication skills.
Interview Questions: nothing special, previous reseach experience

title: IT Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Tl;dr: Interview was straightforward, well rounded, and makes you think a little bit before answering. 

After getting a call off a resume & cover letter, the interview was scheduled with the department director and another staff member. They were appreciative of me including examples in my application of what I've done in the past for development projects and other initiatives.
Interview Questions: What do you think an information technology department should do?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: I was a Masters student when I was asked to apply for an adjunct assistant professor position.  I think I was in the right place at the right time because someone else had just given their notice.  I was offered the position before it was posted online.  It was opened, I applied and the posting was closed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was quick and easy. Be sure to show up on time, but not too early (10 minutes prior). Be prepared for any question asked, and in return be ready to ask a few of your own questions. Be engaged in the interview, show your interest in the company. Most importantly be yourself!
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you and a co-worker had a disagreement. How did it end?

title: Community Program Specialist/Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick and easy interview. Met with my direct supervisor/boss and it was a great way to get to know/feel what to expect from the company.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you using interpreters to obtain research data from patients/subjecst?

title: Customer Relations Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were very straightforward and dealt with working style and general behavioral questions. I met with two of the shift managers  who had very similar questions.  The process took around 5 days for the managers to make their decisions where they chose 10 candidates of a pool of 30.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you had to deal with someone who was frustrated with you regardless of whether or not it was within your control.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Series of interviews: phone, first and second interviews. Was contacted unsolicited through Indeed.com and cleared schedule on short notice for on-campus interviews, which took nearly 4 hours total plus a 30-minute phone interview. Brought writing and presentation samples. Studied website for a minimum of 2 hours. The process is lengthy and sometimes you're simply being interviewed for EOE purposes because they already have someone in mind.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you are interested in the position

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The job interview process can be lengthy. Being interviewed once and getting a job offer is typically a thing of the past. Today, many companies have an involved interview process starting with screening interviews, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews and even third interviews. The job interview process can be lengthy. Being interviewed once and getting a job offer is typically a thing of the past. Today, many companies have an involved interview process starting with screening interviews, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews and even third interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Gopher Chauffeur Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was referred through a friend who already worked there. The supervisor contacted me to come in for a one on one interview at Boynton Health Services. It was mostly questions behavioral questions and hypothetical scenarios.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where you felt a rider was too intoxicated?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Inperson interview with manager,who was very curt and demanding. They wanted to know if I could stand up to opposition or admonishment, and hold my ground against people who wanted to eliminate my position.
Interview Questions: Can you handle angry superiors?

title: Instructor, College of Science and Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Duluth, MN)
Interview Descriptions: I was already familiar with the faculty and was offered the job without an official interview.
Interview Questions: None.

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straightforward. I trained through the University of Minnesota the year prior to working at the Recreation & Wellness Center so I knew a lot of the staff already. The interview in-person was a group interview with three people being interviewed as well as three current senior trainers doing the interviews. It was a pretty straightforward interview with questions you could come to expect at any interview.
Interview Questions: What are some personal strengths?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an online application and was invited in for an interview within 2 weeks.  Was notified that I received the job within 2 weeks of the interview.  Had to return one more time for lab orientation and training, all paid.  Overall a very easy process.
Interview Questions: Do you like bugs?

title: Subject Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was casual and got an offer immediately after the interview. The interviewer took me into his office and we chatted for about 20 minutes. He asked 4 questions regarding the job.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a frustrated student?

title: Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with the direct supervisor, a faculty member, and was offered the job almost immediately. We mostly discussed the job itself, to make sure I knew what was expected.
Interview Questions: To their credit, the interviewer was very interested in my long-term goals, asking what I hoped too get out of the job. I always see this as a good sign.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Applied to program and selected based on undergraduate academic record
Interview Questions: All written questions, no in person interview

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Graduate Program Director. Asked questions on motivation behind pursuing graduate studies.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult or unexpected

title: Pathology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very standard, a lot of the process was understanding the position and touring the facilities. My interview was awhile ago, but the person directing the interview found out about me after I missed out on a different position. I thanked the previous interviewer in a follow-up email. A few days later I received an email from my future supervisor, asking to interview in person. We met at the office I would be doing the majority of work at. He explained his position, the duties that had fallen on him after his predecessor left on short notice with very little training, and did a lot of explaining of my duties. He was interested in my career goals, academic schedule, and intellect.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for me?

title: Administrative Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application in November and didn't hear back until December. The interview process took 2 weeks, but once you hear back, it moves quickly. There are a lot of busy schedule to coordinate. So timing can be difficult. I applied online, did research, reached out via LinkedIn
Interview Questions: It takes time to learn and get acclimated to the University. What are you plans here with the university? (i.e. will you stay for the long haul)

title: Parking Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: It took a couple weeks to hear from the hiring manager after I applied online. I was part of a group interview with 3-4 other students. Interview was very relaxed and easy. Stereotypical interview questions. The interview only involved around 5-7 questions since each person had to answer individually.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength and weakness?

title: Info Tech Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview. It was with a full professor and two other post-doc graduate students. The interview was very friendly and lasted a little over an hour. Most of the questions were aimed at inquiring about where I see myself being the most effective. A lot of time was spent explaining the nature of the work I would be involved with. They gave no indication at the end about if they were leaning toward hiring me or not.
Interview Questions: I found the most difficult question was simply: "What are your constraints?" It was harder to think about and answer that than a straight question about greatest weakness or shortcoming.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: First an application comparable to other graduate engineering programs. No further feedback until acceptance. Then prospective weekend (fun, boozy).
Interview Questions: Resume-based questions from a few profs when most were courting you.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Simply fill out a form of your preference for application. Soon or later when positions are available, you will be contacted and asked if you are still interested in being a TA. The position of which course is highly based on your course grade.
Interview Questions: What is a transistor and how it works? (for semiconductor course)

title: Student Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was rather relaxed. My current supervisor had two general sections of the interview, the first related to logistical aspects the second related to fit in the department and how my interests and ambitions align with the role at hand. The interviewer was specifically looking for someone who had a balance of academic ambition and also the desire to experience some of the extracurricular activities the University has to offer.
Interview Questions: What activities do you participate in outside of academic work?

title: Department Administrator (Assistant to) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sent resume and cover letter directly to the department head late in the process. Was asked to a panel interview of 6 people--department head was not one of them. Learned from the HR person that it was more or less a courtesy interview because one of the people on the panel knew me and vouched for me. It was a regretful performance on my part.
Interview Questions: Behavioral, panel interview.

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Crookston, MN) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Fill out online applications and cover letter. The department head called me and we chatted over the phone. He already knew me, but we made an appointment to visit in person anyway at which point he offered me the appointment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Security Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online through the school website and got invited to the interview. Then I had a face to face interview with the manager. It was quick and easy for anybody. It was even my first interview for a job and I am not even a native English speaker.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you see somebody gets robbed or gets bullied by a bunch of bad guys while you are patrolling on you work shift?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Resume screening, personal statements, GPA, English test scores are necessary and evaluated. Took several weeks for them to decide. I took the offer after it arrives immediately. The department head reached out via email as well.
Interview Questions: What is your undergraduate GPA?

title: Assistant Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview and in person interview. Toured the facilities and the work environment as well as the plot spaces. This involved many miles across the state of Minnesota.
Interview Questions: Ability to travel

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The entire process was very straightforward. After I submitted my application through the University of Minnesota's online job search, I was called within a week to set up an interview, which took place a few days later. They offered me the job within a day after that. They needed someone to start right away, which may have helped the process go faster, but I needed to give a 2 week notice at my previous job, so they were able to be flexible and work around that.
Interview Questions: Name a time you experienced an upset customer or client, and how did you handle it?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Urbana, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Required to give a presentation and meeting the faculty. Meeting with the administrative unit for one day. The presentation included one hour talk and the questions by the attendees. The goal is to discuss what the person will do is offered the job.
Interview Questions: what I plan to teach? What research topic I will be working on?

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Online application, followed by in-person interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Accounts Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The job interview process is very smooth. This job involved interview process starting with screening interviews, followed by in-person interviews.They emailed me to have an interview with the manager. I did, and they told me result the next day.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Building and Grounds Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying on the University's employment site, I received a phone call to schedule an interview.  The interview was with the shift supervisor and the assistant supervisor.  It was extremely casual in dress (jeans & T-shirt would be fine), manner, and content.  I think the interview was just a formality because neither of the 2 interviewers seemed prepared or that interested in doing it.  At the end of a brief interview, I was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Any custodial experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Detroit, MI) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, thoughtful, respectful, friendly and to the point. I interviewed with my direct supervisor initially, and then with two other program directors to determine if we were a good fit.
Interview Questions: What are my strengths and weaknesses.

title: Visitor Relations Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online or in-person application, on-site interview.
Interview Questions: None out of the ordinary.

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I went to one of the branch libraries and met with two librarians. They asked me about my studies and the track(s) I was interested in. The interview was very informal and they really just took time to get to know you as a person. I applied back in April, but technically did not get the job until the following September.
Interview Questions: What is your major?

title: Assistant Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online after seeing a paper posting in my research area. I talked with one of the interviewers prior to the actual interview in regards to what the job entailed and what their perspective of the job, the boss and the university was. I was notified that I was going to go through a personal interview about 6 weeks after applying for the job and received an offer about 4 weeks after that. The interview was a two person panel and they asked me questions about what I wanted out of this job and what I could provide for this research unit. There was nothing really difficult or unexpected about the questioning.
Interview Questions: The questions were all pretty straightforward in regards to the job expectations on my end and the employer's end, as well as what I wanted out of this job.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Saw the posting online, applied through umn portal. Emailed the prof mentioned in umn portal. Got a reply within a week, then a phone call was set up. The next week a meeting was set up and withing 4 days, they gave me the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: The only way to submit your resume is on-line.  However, it helps to have knowledge from the various departments one is interested in working in.  I volunteered for many years in various capacities in order to be known before I interviewed for my position.  It's a fast process once you are accepted.  Renewal contract every year can be stressful.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in the pursuit of your doctorate degree?

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota
Interview Descriptions: Long interview to meet the members of the lab and tour the facility lasting around 2 hours.  Able to see many hands on activities to gauge reaction and interest.  Important to work well with the team and ask questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years?

title: Principal Secretary and Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying on -line, I was contacted approximately 2 weeks later to schedule an interview .  At my interview (friday). I was told that I would hear the following Mon/Tuesday if I would be called back for a second interview with director. Denial email sent 1.5 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Typical questions... how do you resolve conflict, how do you prioritize work with upcoming deadlines... what would you do if you had 2 people come to you needing their work done at the same time....

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brought directly in for an interview. Two interviewers. Just talked about myself and team situations. Asked about times I had to communicate effectively. I was also asked about how I deal with spare time when I would be on the job. It was very straight forward. No complicated questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you had to work on a team.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I participated in a series of interviews. First with the manager, then with the team, and finally with the director. The team was interview had seven participating -- five were from the team I would be working with and there were two people from outside departments in related fields. That interview was structured into four sections with time for questions at the end.
Interview Questions: There was a particularly thorny problem the team was facing in advance of a large scale migration of websites to a new CMS. The manager asked me about what I saw as the options.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Super easy, came in and had a quick and simple interview, heard back immediately. The staff was entirely professional. They made sure I had everything I needed before heading into the interview. 100% would recommend their interview process to anyone.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went well overall.  Please be prepared for both a behavioral and technical interview with specific questions on trends, university objectives, systems and previous expertise and knowledge. Know the organizational objectives, key players, structure and ask good questions. They have great opportunities across the organization.
Interview Questions: I cannot think of any unexpected questions during this interview.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Surprisingly quick, but the hiring manager had reached out to me as a contact since we were acquainted with each other professionally. That greatly expedited the process but I still had to speak with the hiring manager, her executive director, and had a group interview with the team before an offer was presented
Interview Questions: Why was I leaving my current employer

title: Executive Office & Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I was initially contacted by one of the Program Managers to set up an interview date and time via email.  My first interview was on a Monday with the Executive Director.  My second interview was scheduled for Friday of the same week with his executive staff - one Project Manager, one Program Manager, and one Manager of Technology Services.  My third and final interview was scheduled for the following Tuesday with the Executive Director again.  

All four individuals were extremely professional, pleasant, and direct.  Their various personalities were genuinely expressed throughout the interview process, and after working with them for a month, I know that they were being authentic during the interviews.  Their primary interests during the interviews were to be certain that (a) I could not only do the job well, but also be a good fit for their team - my hobbies, interests, and life outlook were important to all of them; and (b) I could interact well with people of diverse cultures and ethnicities across various situations.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in dealing/interacting with people of color, minorities, and/or various cultures?

title: Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, leaders seem not to know direction they are going.  Lots of middle management, without the right skills.  Interview questions very standard.  Some of them were in left field, could tell they were trying to deal with employee issues and wanted me to solve them.
Interview Questions: none, really easy, typical questions asked.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for the cashier position at the University of Minnesota- University Dining Services is fair and easy. To get the job, you have to be a student of the University, either part time of full time and then have good communications skills. Basic math skills are required too , for some positions.
Interview Questions: background check

title: Security Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straight forward and easy and required little to no preparation at all. The interview questions consisted mostly of behavioral/situational questions. I was interviewed by one of the Security Monitor Program Managers who became my direct boss upon employment, so I got to know my employer before even starting.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you encounter two co-workers in conflict?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to many research professors until one hired me.
Interview Questions: None.

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, with two different sets of people -- 2nd interview followed a couple weeks after 1st interview.  Questions were pretty common, no surprises.  Couldn't get any clarity from the HR group as to who I would be interviewing with -- even on the day-of.  That was frustrating.  Decision time: took about a week for them to contact me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Main Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was easy, basic questions from the interviewer. This was for a job right out of high school so there's not a lot you can talk about. Now interviewing people for the same job I can tell you that they hire on personality and work ethic.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an online job advertisement, which asked for a cover letter, CV, and three references. I was then asked to have an interview over skype since I was on a different continent. I had the interview and several weeks later was offered the job via email.
Interview Questions: None really, the interview was very straightforward.

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: spoke directly with department I was being hired for.  Didn't have to go through a number of separate interviews.  Interviewer was calm and easy going.  Seemed like the group was excited to have me working for them.
Interview Questions: Relate education and experience to the position being applied for.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a phone interview about a week later. There was nothing unexpected in the phone interview - they just clarified my skills and made sure that I was a good fit. I asked a lot of questions regarding what they expected of me and more specifics about the job. Soon after I learned that I'd gotten the position! Overall an easy process!
Interview Questions: There was nothing unexpected. They just wanted to clarify my skills and make sure I was a good fit.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: No such interview process in general. Applied to the university for various positions available and was able to work with a faculty who offered a Research position. The interview was 1 on 1 and the professor asked questions about your previous experience and background.
Interview Questions: How do you think you can contribute to the research that we are doing?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was one interview. Behavioral and resume review. Got back within 3 business days with an offer for the Project Management Assistant with Office of Information Technology
Interview Questions: Do you use MS Word frequently?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied through the UMN employment site, which allows you to directly upload all your documents (CV, cover letter, etc.). Within several days I was emailed to set up an interview time. Several days later I had my interview on site and was then given a tour of our building. Within a week I was called with notification that I was given the position! Email communication was always very prompt.
Interview Questions: As I was working in a department within the medical school, many questions involved patient privacy within clinical trials, familiarities with HIPPA guidelines, etc.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Morris, MN) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: At first it was with a phone interview. Then there was a 2 hour meeting in person broken up into 4 15 minute sessions with breaks in between. One meeting was one-on-one. One was with a small group, then a larger group, and a larger group. They showed me around and were very friendly. This was a different interview than I expected, but it was a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: They described a typical situation that comes up for the administrative position and asked how I would handle it.

title: Student Development Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was incredibly easy. Basically if they ask you to come in for a second interview after the phone interview you have the job.
Interview Questions: Do you like telemarketers?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I emailed professors about possible open positions in their lab, and communicated via email to organize an interview. A single one on one interview followed, both times a job offer was made on the spot. One position was unpaid initially, with pay starting later on, and the other job was a work study position at the University.
Interview Questions: What do you want to gain from this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Meet and talk with the Professor and the group members. Waited for 2 months for the response. I was able to join because one of the group members decided to leave. The wait is usually not this long, though. Usually people get hired early in the semester (September).
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Just a typical interview. You meet with the Business Operations Supervisor of the building you are applying for and they ask you a series of questions (about 12 questions). It's a one-on-one interview and it typically lasts about 30 min. Once you finish they give you an estimate of when they'll get back to you (typically it's a week or 2 depending on when you apply and how many people applied).
Interview Questions:
-Tell me about a time when you provided excellent customer service?
-Tell me about a time when you disagreed with someone and how you dealt with the situation?

title: Junior Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: no interview, informal referral and subsequent job offer received. The university is built almost entirely on referrals. If you know someone, this is by far the easiest way to get a job there.
Interview Questions: How long would you like to stay at the University

title: Undergraduate Programs Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and a cover letter for the vacancy when it was announced via the department's list serve. I got a call back to set up a face to face interview. I didn't receive a job offer initially but the following semester I was offered the position and I accepted.
Interview Questions: I think the most difficult question was how would I apply student development theory to my everyday work with undergraduate students.  There isn't a real right or wrong answer but I think the interviewer was looking to see if you were aware of  applicable theories that might help guide you in working with a diverse student population

title: IST Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: One on on interview.
Interview Questions: If I could work over the Summer?

title: Junior Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I sent email cover letters with attached CV to Professors looking for scientists in labs at the UMN.
I received an email within a week that he was interested.  He asked me if he could call me for a quick interview.  He called a few days later and discussed passed experience in prior lab.  I was from another country so we spoke also about what was required to get me working there.  I told him I needed a detailed offer letter with job description, salary and length of employment for my work visa.  The conversation lasted about 45 min.  He told me he would be in touch.  He emailed me an offer letter within a week. I accepted within a week and we got the process going.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: one officer from UROP and one professor asked my background and specialties. Start from my courses and then the research that I had done before. They prefer programming on Labview, Arduino and Matlab to do signal processing and autoprocessing programming. Also they asked your work experience.
Interview Questions: Do you use Matlab and Labview before

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Casual, roundtable, me and three professors. They asked me what I was interested in and left it very open for me to talk about my interests. I went to talk to different labs and professors. They reviewed my GRE scores and college transcript. Because I took 2 years off between undergraduate school and graduate school we talked about this gap as well.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in studying?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: You apply with a formal application. The most important aspects are your GPA, undergraduate institution, and letters of recommendation. Prior research experience and publications are a definite advantage. If accepted, you can visit and meet the students/professors.
Interview Questions: Are you looking for experimental or computational work?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submit application, interview with assistant director
Interview Questions: What kind of resources have you used on campus?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable and useful. Coordinate provide us lots of information and simple course introduction. All of us enjoyed it and the whole process is short and arrange well. After we get to college, all of them exactly same as they introduced In the interview
Interview Questions: How do you know our program

title: IT Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
First Interview
The first in-person job interview is typically a one-on-one interview between the applicant and a hiring manager. The interviewer will ask questions about the applicant's experience and skills, work history, availability, and the qualifications the company is seeking in the optimal candidate for the job. More »

Second Interview
A second interview can be a more in-depth one-on-one interview with the person you originally interviewed with or it can be a day-long interview that includes meetings with company staff. You may meet with management, staff members, executives, and other company employees. More »
Interview Questions: Why?

title: TA - Urban Studies Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't really an interview process - they were just looking for a qualified candidate who had taken the class before.  You fill out an application and as long as you have a good relationship with the Department and/or the teacher in question, you stand a pretty good chance of getting the position.  Talk about no stress.
Interview Questions: Have you taken the class previously?  What was your final grade?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a brief phone interview where credentials and scheduling options were addressed. The next step was an in-person interview in the bookstore facilities with a higher level manager than the floor staff manager. The interviewer was a full time employee. The managers are very understanding of student life.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would deal with an upset customer?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by them via e-mail asking to apply, I did so and was accepted.
Interview Questions: None, no interview.

title: Recruiting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Knew an internal employee. They contacted me and asked me to apply and interview. The department flew me up for an interview. I interviewed with the entire department. Really standard questions. They made an offer about a week later. I was waiting on another offer but eventually took the position.
Interview Questions: How do you handle co-workers gossip?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions:
After applying through the University's HR website, I was invited to interview before a 4-person selection committee, 3 members were from the office that was hiring with the 4th from a related office.  They were obviously asking the same questions of each interviewee but the questions were applicable to the specific position that I was interviewing for.  Because of the standardization, they didn't ask follow-up questions or give much feedback, and it was a challenge to show personality and make connections with each person but possible with conscious effort.

The second interview was much more informal and was basically a chat in a coffee shop to make sure I was a good fit for the office culture.  I toured the office and was introduced to the full team.  I believe they did this with one other final candidate.
Interview Questions: Always ALWAYS have a specific answer to why you want to work at the U of M, school/department, and office.

title: Classroom Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview for a work study based position.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Coordinator (Professional & Administrative - P&A Level) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Separate on-site interviews with different faculty members on site, also met or interviewed with other staff that I would be working with if I was given the job.  Other interactions by phone and email during the consideration process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Saint Paul, MN) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with a professor whom had interesting research and became employed in their lab after asking
Interview Questions: Does not really apply, I had no formal interview.

title: Junior Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: My initial communication began by emailing a research professor who emailed me back three weeks later telling me the email mysteriously took three weeks for her to receive.  Although I saw this was a red flag, I was desperate for a job.
Interview Questions: What kind of research did you do before?

title: IT Helpdesk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly easy.  There were some situational questions and some technical questions about computers.  It was very easy going, as one would expect from a student job.  It was a very enjoyable experience.  If you know how to troubleshoot computers on a basic level, you should have no problem.
Interview Questions: How would you troubleshoot a printer problem?

title: LEED Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I found the interview to be straightforward. A duo of supervisors read through a list of standard questions recommended by the University. It was a wide-ranging discussion with plenty of give and take. By the end I felt like I had a good understanding of what they were looking for and my expectations were met.
Interview Questions: What would you say defines sustainable neighborhoods?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Asks a lot of questions about diversity and acceptance.  Also asks about times when you've worked through difficult situations and your method for building community.
Interview Questions: The most difficult was talking about how diversity impacts the community and how you would handle a situation where students weren't open to accepting others.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was just an average interview. I think there were a lot of applicants.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for us.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position through the graduate school and my specific department in late December and was contacted about acceptance in March, fairly early for a graduate school. The application included a personal statement and a statement of diversity (i.e. how I would contribute to the University's diversity). I got a competitive offer, visited the school in person (visit was paid for by the school) and decided to accept the offer. I started graduate school the following August.
Interview Questions: I wasn't sure how to answer the diversity question because I am not a minority in most situations. I acknowledged that in the statement and discussed how my educational experience would give me unique insights, another type of 'diversity.'

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: We applied ath University's website, wait a couple months, got called for interview, waited 2 weeks, offer was made.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was okay... the actual hiring manager seeming like a wonderful person, but was very busy.  I was only able to speak with him for 15 minutes.  Spoke to HR and one other person.  
I still left optimistic... but somewhat concerned about potential conflict with another admin that was already there and not performing well.  They planned to hire me and keep her.  Follow-up was slow; I left messages for HR that took over a week to be returned.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
The University only allows online submissions though its HR portal, so this was how I applied. From knowing people who work at the University, I must say that this process is ridiculous. If you miss mentioning one single task that is required for the position (like not putting down that you know how to answer a phone, even though you've been a secretary for ten years), your application is rejected. 

I was called for an interview for a union-represented executive assistant position in the Office of the Vice President for Research, so the interview had to go completely according to the union mandates. There were three people present during the interview and the questions were stock questions that asked about my general skills. After the interview, I was offered the position but was appalled at the amount of pay they offered. They said that the union stipulated what pay could be earned, but I did some investigating on pay, which is made public, and found that the union excuse was a load of bull. I've since learned from employees that low-balling in the pay negotiation phase is rampant and that its not unheard of at all to find out that a gullible supervisor with 10 years experience isn't earning as much as a new hire working for them. It's all a lot of lies apparently.
Interview Questions: What was the worst thing about your last job?

title: Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: My initial communication with the supervisors at Ted Mann Concert Hall was via email, and soon after I was invited to take a tour and have an informal interview.  The House Managers were courteous and well-spoken, and were very direct.  The interview was short, and I didn't have a clear idea of how they felt about me.
Interview Questions: What do you feel has best prepared you to work here?

title: Computer Support Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was asked general work related questions about my resume and technical questions related to the job.
Interview Questions: Describe an unsuccessful hardware repair.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Submit your application, wait for an email invitation from the head of the clinic. They will ask you to fly in for a full day interview, where you will interview with almost every one of the full-time faculty. If you've made it to this point, they are mostly just looking at if they can get along with you and if you have a sincere interest in working for the clinic.
Interview Questions: What is your theoretical orientation?

title: Program Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was a very good experience. I went in and they asked me questions about my experience and I had the job by 11am that morning.
Interview Questions: What was your previous experience like?

title: Info Tech Advanced Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Started off by coming in to the office to talk about the job.  This first meeting wasn't an interview, it was more of a pre-interview get to know everyone kind of thing.  Then the actual interview happened about a week later.  I was interviewed by the IT supervisor and was asked the typical interview questions (i.e. where do you see yourself in 5-10 year).  Was offered a job on the spot as I was a good friend of the previous employee who was leaving.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?

title: Promotions Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite simple.  It involved walking the panel of three interviewers through your resume.  After that, they each had about three to four behavioral-based questions for you to answer.  The atmosphere was quite casual and took place in their conference room.  I still advise that you dress business professional and to not be afraid to show some personality
Interview Questions: Tell us your biggest weakness as an employee.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my resume and research summary to the contact info by email and since my qualifications are very closely matched to the job qualifications, I got an email from the professor asking some questions about my time line, general questions about my previous experiences, etc and what would be a good time for me to visit the campus and interview.

They asked me to buy the plane ticket and I got instructions on accommodations and the schedule for the day of the interview.

The day before the interview, the professor came to the hotel and took me to dinner. We chatted mostly about the potential project and about the city.

The day of the interview, I presented my work in front of the research group. They asked questions related to the talk. Then it was one-on-one talk with the Prof followed by lunch. Then I got a tour of the facilities by the staff and a tour of the lab by the students. It takes awhile to go from building to building since the U is big. At the end of the day, I met the Prof again in her office, and basically was told that I will be offered the job, but no specifics. A week later, I got the offer and since I like the research facilities, I took the job.
Interview Questions: A grad student asked me for some suggestions for her current project.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Minnesota (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: Very fair and honest, well thought out hiring process and plan. The search team was well organized, prompt, and professional. There were several interviews, on the phone, and two on campus interviews with constituents and the workgroup. They were honest about what they wanted, skill sets, personalities, etc.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was not technical, but rather how to handle situations in which the outcomes were out of your control. Not a trick question, but surprising. It took a while to formulate a decent answer.
